[[Tom Matukewicz]] (1â0) | OffCoach = | DefCoach = | OScheme = | DScheme = | StadiumArena = [[Huskie Stadium]] (30,076)http://www.collegegridirons.com/mac/HuskieStadium.htm | BowlTourney = [[2010 Humanitarian Bowl|Humanitarian Bowl]] vs. [[2010 Fresno State Bulldogs football team| Fresno State]] | BowlTourneyResult = W 40â17 | Champion = MAC West Division Champions
Humanitarian Bowl Champions | ConfChamp = [[2010 MAC Championship Game|MAC Championship]] vs.[[2010 Miami RedHawks football team| Miami (OH)]] | ConfChampResult = L 21â26 | uniform = }} {{2010 Mid-American Conference football standings}} The '''2010 [[Northern Illinois Huskies football]] team''' represented [[Northern Illinois University]] in the college football season of [[2010]]. They compete in [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]] (NCAA) [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] [[Division I (NCAA)#Football Bowl Subdivision|Football Bowl Subdivision]] (FBS) [[college football]] during the [[2010 NCAA Division I FBS football season|football season]]. Northern Illinois competed as a member of the [[Mid-American Conference]] (MAC) West Division. They were coached by [[Jerry Kill]] (3rd Season) and played their home games at [[Huskie Stadium]]. The Huskies finished the season 11â3, 8â0 in MAC play to win the west division and lost to [[2010 Miami RedHawks football team|Miami (OH)]] in the [[2010 MAC Championship Game|MAC Championship Game]]. They were invited to the [[2010 Humanitarian Bowl|Humanitarian Bowl]] where they defeated [[2010 Fresno State Bulldogs football team|Fresno State]] 40â17. Jerry Kill resigned as head coach following the MAC Championship game to accept the head coaching position at [[Minnesota Golden Gophers football| Minnesota]]. Kill did not coach in the Humanitarian Bowl. On December 9th, [[Tom Matukewicz]] was announced as the interim head coach for the Huskies bowl game.http://today.niu.edu/2010/12/07/12132/ == Preseason == * Northern Illinois was considered the favorite in the Pre-season Poll to win the West Division for the [[2010 Mid-American Conference football season|MAC]]. ===Recruiting=== {{College Athlete Recruit Start|40=yes|collapse=yes|year=2010}} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Tyler Anderson | position = [[Placekicker|K]] | hometown = Rockford, IL | highschool = [[Guilford High School (Illinois)|Guilford H.S.]] | feet = 5 | inches = 11 | weight = 186 | 40 = - Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 1-2 | 2004 | ISU, 48-41 |} {{-}} Despite being without the services of starting QB Chandler Harnish, the Huskies pulled within a touchdown midway through the 4th quarter on a 1 yard touchdown run by backup signal caller DeMarcus Grady. But an Iowa State touchdown drive immediately thereafter put the game away for the Cyclones. ===North Dakota=== {{See also| North Dakota Fighting Sioux football}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road= Fighting Sioux |R1= 0 |R2= 7 |R3= 7 |R4= 3 |Home= '''Huskies''' |H1= 13 |H2= 3 |H3= 0 |H4= 7 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 0-1 | 1965 | ND, 37-20 |} {{-}} *Hours after the 23-17 win against North Dakota, Coach [[Jerry Kill]] was hospitalized for dehydration. He would be released and return to coach the Huskies against Illinois the following week.http://www.huskiewire.com/blogs/entries/2010/09/12/78848211/index.xml ===Illinois=== {{See also|2010 Illinois Fighting Illini football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road='''Huskies''' |R1= 12 |R2= 0 |R3= 0 |R4= 10 |Home=Fighting Illini |H1= 7 |H2= 11 |H3= 0 |H4= 10 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 0-3 | 2001 | U of I, 17-12 |} The Huskie defense was scorched on the ground, allowing 319 rushing yards to the Fighting Illini, and NIU star tailback Chad Spann was held to only 15 yards on 13 carries. QB Chandler Harnish had a strong performance, but lost a fumble in Illinois territory in the 4th quarter that proved to be costly. * [[Punter (football)|P]]-Josh Wilber was named the [[Mid-American Conference]] West Division Special Teams Player of the Week. Wilber Averaged 49.0 yards on five punts, with 3 punt's over 50 yards.http://mac-sports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?&SPSID=42968&SPID=3802&DB_OEM_ID=9400&ATCLID=204997548 ===Minnesota=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Minnesota Golden Gophers football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road='''Huskies''' |R1= 7 |R2= 13 |R3= 0 |R4= 14 |Home=Golden Gophers |H1= 3 |H2= 10 |H3= 3 |H4= 7 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 0-2 | 2008 | MINN, 31-27 |} The win was the third over a Big Ten school in the history of the program, and the second in as many years. * [[Running Back|RB]]-Chad Spann was named [[Mid-American Conference]] West Division Offensive Player of the Week and [[Walter Camp Football Foundation]] Player of the Week. Spann rushed for 223 yards and two touchdowns on 15 carries.http://www.daily-chronicle.com/articles/2010/09/27/95561719/index.xml {{-}} ===Akron=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Akron Zips football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road='''Huskies''' |R1= 6 |R2= 23 |R3= 14 |R4= 7 |Home= Zips |H1= 7 |H2= 0 |H3= 7 |H4= 0 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 6-5 | 2009 | NIU, 27-10 |} * [[quarterback|QB]]-Chandler Harnish was named [[Mid-American Conference]] West Division Offensive Player of the Week. Harnish completed 16-of-20 passes for 281 yards and three touchdowns in three quarters of action while leading the Huskies to a 50-14 victory at Akron.http://www.mac-sports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?&DB_OEM_ID=9400&ATCLID=205006421 ===Temple=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Temple Owls football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road= Owls |R1= 7 |R2= 10 |R3= 0 |R4= 0 |Home= '''Huskies''' |H1= 7 |H2= 10 |H3= 7 |H4= 7 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 3-2-1 | 2007 | TEM, 16-15 |} * In a matchup of preseason MAC favorites, the Huskies took over in the second half thanks in large part to a dominant and balanced offensive performance that wore the Owls down on a warm day in DeKalb. * [[quarterback|QB]]-Chandler Harnish was named [[Mid-American Conference]] West Division Offensive Player of the Week. Harnish accounted for 282 yards of total offense with 211 yards passing and 71 rushing in Northern Illinois' 31-17 victory over Temple.http://www.mac-sports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?&SPSID=42968&SPID=3802&DB_OEM_ID=9400&ATCLID=205010052 ===Buffalo=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Buffalo Bulls football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road= Bulls |R1= 0 |R2= 14 |R3= 0 |R4= 0 |Home= '''Huskies''' |H1= 0 |H2= 21 |H3= 10 |H4= 14 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 5-1 | 2006 | NIU, 31-13 |} * [[Safety (American football position)|S]]-Jimmie Ward was named [[Mid-American Conference]] West Division Special Teams Player of the Week. The Freshman from Mobile, Alabama recorded his second blocked punt of the season in a 45-14 win over Buffalo.http://www.mac-sports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?&SPSID=42968&SPID=3802&DB_OEM_ID=9400&ATCLID=205014077 ===Central Michigan=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Central Michigan Chippewas football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road= Chippewas |R1= 0 |R2= 7 |R3= 0 |R4= 0 |Home= '''Huskies''' |H1= 3 |H2= 6 |H3= 14 |H4= 10 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 12-12 | 2009 | CMU, 45-31 |} NIU continues its 2nd-half dominance against MAC foes, not allowing a point in the 2nd half for the third straight week. * [[Linebacker|LB]]- Tyrone Clark was named [[Mid-American Conference]] West Division Defensive Player of the Week. Clark picked off two passes in Northern Illinois' 33-7 win over Central Michigan. Clarkâs two interceptions came in the second quarter, both coming off of tipped balls.http://www.footballreportersonline.com/?p=4239 ===Western Michigan=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Western Michigan Broncos football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road= '''Huskies''' |R1= 0 |R2= 13 |R3= 7 |R4= 8 |Home= Broncos |H1= 7 |H2= 7 |H3= 0 |H4= 7 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 12-22 | 2009 | NIU, 38-3 |} Quarterback Chandler Harnish found Willie Clark with a 21-yard TD pass with 3:42 to play to lift the Huskies (7-2, 5-0 Mid-American Conference) to their six straight victory, their longest winning streak since 2004. * [[Defensive End|DE]]- Jake Coffman was named [[Mid-American Conference]] West Division Defensive Player of the Week. Coffman came down with a win-clinching interception during the Huskies' 28-21 victory at Western Michigan. Coffman also had four tackles, 1.5 tackles for loss and half a sack.http://www.huskiewire.com/blogs/entries/2010/11/01/77188996/index.xml ===Toledo=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Toledo Rockets football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road= Rockets |R1= 0 |R2= 0 |R3= 23 |R4= 7 |Home= '''Huskies''' |H1= 7 |H2= 21 |H3= 28 |H4= 9 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 8-28 | 2009 | TOL, 20-19 |} Toledo could not hold on against NIU's offense as the Huskies dominated the Rockets with Chad Spann scoring 3 touchdowns and Chandler Harnish going 11-of-16 for 162 yards. The Huskies (8-2, 6-0 Mid-American) now have a 7-game winning streak and are edging closer to the MAC championship. * [[quarterback|QB]]-Chandler Harnish was named [[Mid-American Conference]] West Division Offensive Player of the Week for the third time this season. He went 11-of-16 for 162 yards and rushed for 149 yards as well as scoring a touchdown on a 28-yard run.http://www.dailyherald.com/article/20101115/sports/711169846/ ===Ball State=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Ball State Cardinals football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road= '''Huskies''' |R1= 14 |R2= 21 |R3= 10 |R4= 14 |Home= Cardinals |H1= 0 |H2= 7 |H3= 14 |H4= 0 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 13-19-1 | 2009 | NIU, 26-20 |} While winning its eighth straight game and clinching the Mid-American Conference West Division title , the Northern Illinois Huskies excelled on offense, defense and special teams en route to a 59-21 victory. * [[linebacker|LB]]- Jordan Delegal was named [[Mid-American Conference]] West Division Special Teams Player of the Week. Delegal blocked two punts in a 59-21 win at Ball State and the Huskies set a school record with three blocked punts in the game. http://sportstalknetwork.com/cleveland/blog/?p=61 ===Eastern Michigan=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Eastern Michigan Eagles football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road= '''Huskies''' |R1= 20 |R2= 17 |R3= 21 |R4= 13 |Home= Eagles |H1= 0 |H2= 3 |H3= 0 |H4= 0 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 16-5-2 | 2009 | NIU, 50-6 |} The Huskies had 654 yards on 46 plays, rushing for 552 yards, with most of the starters on the sideline for the second half. The Huskies (10-2, 8-0 MAC) swept MAC play for the first time in school history and will play Miami (8-4, 7-1) in the MAC Championship. It was the 5th most points scored by the Huskies in school History. * [[Defensive End|DE]]- Jake Coffman was named [[Mid-American Conference]] West Division Defensive Player of the Week. Coffman finished with five solo tackles, one sack, two tackles for loss and a forced fumble as he led the way for Northern Illinois 71-3 win at Eastern Michigan.http://sportstalknetwork.com/cleveland/blog/Index.php?cat=28&paged=3 ===MAC Championship: Miami (OH)=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Miami RedHawks football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road= RedHawks |R1=13 |R2=0 |R3=7 |R4=6 |Home= #25 '''Huskies''' |H1=14 |H2=0 |H3=0 |H4=7 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 7-7 | 2009 | NIU 27-22 |} Armand Robinson caught a 33-yard touchdown pass from Austin Boucher with 33 seconds remaining, lifting Miami to a stunning 26-21 upset of No. 25 Northern Illinois in the 2010 Marathon MAC Championship Game at Ford Field. The win marked the second time the RedHawks had won the league title game and completed a worst-to-first league finish. ===2010 uDrove Humanitarian Bowl: Fresno State=== {{-}} {{See also|2010 Fresno State Bulldogs football team}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road= Bulldogs |R1= 7 |R2= 3 |R3= 0 |R4= 7 |Home= '''Huskies''' |H1= 6 |H2= 17 |H3= 10 |H4= 7 }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Overall Record ! Last Meeting ! Result |- | 2-2 | 1991 | Fresno 55-7 |} == References == {{reflist}} == External links == *[http://www.niuhuskies.com/sports/m-footbl/niu-m-footbl-body.html Northern Illinois Huskies Football official website] {{2010 Mid-American Conference football season}} [[Category:2010 Mid-American Conference football season|Northern Illinois]] [[Category:Northern Illinois Huskies football seasons]] [[Category:Humanitarian Bowl champion seasons]]
